lead_paragraph: Gov. Pete Wilson signed into law today a requirement that California's 850,000 motorcyclists wear helmets when riding on the state's roads. "I am signing this bill today because, simply put, this law will save lives," Mr. Wilson said. State Assemblyman Dick Floyd, the author of the bill, said hundreds of lives would have been saved if it had been enacted when he first proposed it a decade ago. The new restrictions, which take effect on Jan. 1, impose a $100 fine for a violation.

headline.main: Use of Motorcycle Helmets Signed Into Law in California
